biography.value:
The retriever is a potent, spider-like Construct conceived and built by Underdark followers of Lolth for one original purpose—to prowl the Abyss and capture demons for these cultists to enslave or use in their rituals. The automatons proved so effective and so fearsome that they now perform many different missions.

Though retrievers were created to operate only in the Abyss, they are sometimes dispatched when a powerful devotee of Lolth needs some creature or object captured and brought back alive and intact. Only under the rarest of circumstances is a retriever handed over or sold to others, since Lolth’s cultists don’t want to take the chance that their creations will be turned against them.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

languages.custom: understands Abyssal, Elvish, and Undercommon but can’t speak

description.value:
The retriever makes two Foreleg attacks, and it uses &Reference[force]{Force} Beam or Paralyzing Beam, if available.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a [[/save dex 16 format=long]], taking [[/damage 5d10 type=force average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a [[/save con 18 format=long]] or be &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for 1 minute. The &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

If the &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} creature is Medium or smaller, the retriever can pick it up as part of the retriever’s move and walk or climb with it at full speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The retriever casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

3/day each: plane shift (only self and up to one &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} creature, which is considered willing for the spell), web

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Faultless Tracker. The retriever is given a quarry by its master. The quarry can be a specific creature or object the master is personally acquainted with, or it can be a general type of creature or object the master has seen before. The retriever knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The retriever can have only one such quarry at a time. The retriever also always knows the location of its master.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Special Notes: only self and up to one incapacitated creature.

You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of &Reference[fire]{Fire} or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination. If you are trying to reach the City of Brass, for example, you might arrive in its Street of Steel, before its Gate of Ashes, or looking at the city from across the Sea of &Reference[fire]{Fire}, at the GM's discretion.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

You can use this spell to banish an unwilling creature to another plane. Choose a creature within your reach and make a melee spell attack against it. On a hit, the creature must make a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw. If the creature fails this save, it is transported to a random location on the plane of existence you specify. A creature so transported must find its own way back to your current plane of existence.

items.name: Plane Shift (only self and up to one incapacitated creature)

description.value:
You conjure a mass of thick, sticky webbing at a point of your choice within range. The webs fill a 20-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} from that point for the duration. The webs are difficult terrain and lightly obscure their area.

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the conjured web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

Each creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them during its turn must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is &Reference[restrained]{restrained} as long as it remains in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the webs can use its action to make a &Reference[str]{Strength} check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer &Reference[restrained]{restrained}.

The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} of webs exposed to &Reference[fire]{fire} burns away in 1 round, dealing 2d4 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage to any creature that starts its turn in the &Reference[fire]{fire}.

macro.name: Web

innate.name: which is considered willing for the spell)

edgeCases.name: plane shift
